### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE Department (
  department_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  department_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  department_head VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE Employee (
  employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  department_id INT NOT NULL,
  employee_role VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (department_id) REFERENCES Department(department_id)
)

CREATE TABLE CommunicationLog (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_id INT NOT NULL,
  log_date DATE NOT NULL,
  communication_content TEXT NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES Employee(employee_id)
)

### STATEMENT

UPDATE Department SET department_name = 'Finance' WHERE department_id = 1;

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE departments (
  department_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  department_name TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE employees (
  employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_name TEXT,
  department_id INT REFERENCES departments(department_id)
)

CREATE TABLE products (
  product_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  product_name TEXT,
  product_price DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE orders (
  order_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  product_id INT REFERENCES products(product_id),
  order_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE transactions (
  transaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  order_id INT REFERENCES orders(order_id),
  employee_id INT REFERENCES employees(employee_id),
  transaction_amount DECIMAL
)

### STATEMENT

UPDATE departments SET department_name = 'Sales' WHERE department_id = 1;
